intro: Senecio natalicola, commonly known as the Natalicola groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
